definition: to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: Being attacked on all sides, Rome had to call back her armies to protect what was left of the empire.
sentences.chinese: 罗马四面受敌，只得调遣军队来保卫帝国仅存的部分。

sentences.english: Guests have access to a 24-hour butler and a Rolls-Royce on standby ($5,897; hongkong.peninsula.com ).
sentences.chinese: 有24小时随时待命的男管家和劳斯莱斯供客人调遣。

sentences.english: US troops line up to storm a house.
sentences.chinese: 美军调遣部队袭击了一所房屋。

definition: to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to wait for (orders, a decision, a judgment)
to govern/to have complete control over/to be in command of
an order (esp. army)/bugle call expressing military order/verbal command
(of troops stationed in a strategic area) to defend/(fig.) to stand guard/to protect
